devdoc.details: Public functions calling external contracts do not guard against reentrancy because they are expected to be called via delegatecall, which will execute this contract's logic within the context of the originating contract. For example, the HubPool will delegatecall these functions, therefore its only necessary that the HubPool's methods that call this contract's logic guard against reentrancy.

params._l2RefundAddress: address that recieves excess gas refunds on L2.

returns._0: amount of ETH that this contract needs to hold in order for relayMessage to succeed.

params.target: Contract on L2 that will receive message.

params.amount: Amount of L1 tokens to deposit and L2 tokens to receive.

getL1CallValue().notice: Returns required amount of ETH to send a message.

relayMessage(address,bytes).notice: Send cross-chain message to target on ZkSync.This contract must hold at least getL1CallValue() amount of ETH to send a message, or the message will revert.

relayTokens(address,address,uint256,addr.notice: Bridge tokens to ZkSync.This contract must hold at least getL1CallValue() amount of ETH to send a message or the message will revert.

userdoc.notice: Contract containing logic to send messages from L1 to ZkSync.
